Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Toast \Toast\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Toasted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Toasting}.] [OF. toster to roast, toast, fr. L. torrere, tostum, to parch, roast. See {Torrid}.] 1. To dry and brown by the heat of a fire; as, to toast bread. [1913 Webster]
2. To warm thoroughly; as, to toast the feet. [1913 Webster]
3. To name when a health is proposed to be drunk; to drink to the health, or in honor, of; as, to toast a lady. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Toasting \Toast"ing\, a. & n. from {Toast}, v. [1913 Webster]
{Toasting fork}, a long-handled fork for toasting bread, cheese, or the like, by the fire. [1913 Webster]
toasting n : cooking to a brown crispiness over a fire or on a grill; "proper toasting should brown both sides of a piece of bread" [syn: {browning}]
